page.title: 09Canvey - The Lake (4)
page.content: Schools on Canvey are to be allocated a section of the banks in which they will be involved in annual wild life and conservation presentations.This is part of the close liason between schools and the projects organisers in a bid through education to lessen the vandalism and rubbish dumping although local residents are sceptical about this having much effect at snakes bridge a rubbish black spot. The changes are welcomed by the residents some of which signed a petition in 1983 demanding that something was done about the lake. Two years later they appreciate being able to see the water again now that a lot of the reeds have been cleared.Birds to be seen on the lake at the moment are mallards, Aylesburys, Swans, Coots, Moorhens, Pied Wagtails as visitors.
